00001 #ifndef COPY_H_
00002 #define COPY_H_
00003 
00004 //
00005 // opt::copy
00006 // same semantics as std::copy
00007 // calls memcpy where appropriate.
00008 //
00009 
00010 #include <boost/type_traits.hpp>
00011 NS_IZENELIB_UTIL_BEGIN
00012 {
00013 
00014 template<typename I1, typename I2, bool b>
00015 I2 copy_imp(I1 first, I1 last, I2 out, const boost::integral_constant<bool, b>&)
00016 {
00017    while(first != last)
00018    {
00019       *out = *first;
00020       ++out;
00021       ++first;
00022    }
00023    return out;
00024 }
00025 
00026 template<typename T>
00027 T* copy_imp(const T* first, const T* last, T* out, const boost::true_type&)
00028 {
00029    memcpy(out, first, (last-first)*sizeof(T));
00030    return out+(last-first);
00031 }
00032 
00033 
00034 }
00035 
00036 template<typename I1, typename I2>
00037 inline I2 copy(I1 first, I1 last, I2 out)
00038 {
00039    //
00040    // We can copy with memcpy if T has a trivial assignment operator,
00041    // and if the iterator arguments are actually pointers (this last
00042    // requirement we detect with overload resolution):
00043    //
00044    typedef typename std::iterator_traits<I1>::value_type value_type;
00045    return detail::copy_imp(first, last, out, boost::has_trivial_assign<value_type>());
00046 }
00047 
00048 NS_IZENELIB_UTIL_END
00049 
00050 #endif /*COPY_H_*/
